    • Method Detail

      • canContainUrl

        public static boolean canContainUrl(java.lang.String line)
        Returns:
        if false, then the line contains no URL; if true, then more heavy URL_PATTERN check should be used.

      • openStream

        public static java.io.InputStream openStream(java.net.URL url)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Opens a url stream. The semantics is the sames as URL.openStream(). The separate method is needed, since jar URLs open jars via JarFactory and thus keep them mapped into memory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • openResourceStream

        public static java.io.InputStream openResourceStream(java.net.URL url)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • resourceExists

        public static ThreeState resourceExists(java.net.URL url)
        Checks whether local resource specified by url exists. Returns ThreeState.UNSURE if url point to a remote resource.

      • splitJarUrl

        public static Pair<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> splitJarUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Splits .jar URL along a separator and strips "jar" and "file" prefixes if any. Returns a pair of path to a .jar file and entry name inside a .jar, or null if the URL does not contain a separator.

        E.g. "jar:file:///path/to/jar.jar!/resource.xml" is converted into ["/path/to/jar.jar", "resource.xml"].

        Please note that the first part is platform-dependent - see UrlUtilTest.testJarUrlSplitter() for examples.

      • urlToFile

        public static java.io.File urlToFile(java.net.URL url)

        public static boolean isDataUri(java.lang.String value)

      • getBytesFromDataUri

        public static byte [] getBytesFromDataUri(java.lang.String dataUrl)
        Extracts byte array from given data:URL string. data:URL will be decoded from base64 if it contains the marker of base64 encoding.
        Parameters:
        dataUrl - data:URL-like string (may be quoted)
        Returns:
        extracted byte array or null if it cannot be extracted.

      • decode

        public static java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String string)

                                          java.lang.String pathInJar)
                                   throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException

                                          java.lang.String pathInJar)
                                   throws java.net.MalformedURLException

      • getJarEntryUri

        public static java.net.URI getJarEntryUri(java.net.URI file,
                                          java.lang.String pathInJar)
                                   throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException

      • encodeURIComponent

        public static java.lang.String encodeURIComponent(java.lang.String s)
        Encodes a URI component by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character. Behaves similarly to standard JavaScript build-in function encodeURIComponent.
        Parameters:
        s - a component of a URI
        Returns:
        a new string representing the provided string encoded as a URI component

      • findUrl

        public static TextRange findUrl(java.lang.CharSequence text,
                                int startOffset,
                                int endOffset)
        Finds the first range in text containing URL. This is similar to using URL_PATTERN matcher, but also finds URLs containing matched set of parentheses.
